original_text:
Haunted House
Quando si parla di diffusione di slot in Italia, ci sono due titoli che vengono alla mente della maggior parte delle persone. Entrambi questi giochi sono della casa di sviluppo WMG e devono la loro fama a una combinazione di gioco intuitivo, grafica accattivante e distribuzione capillare in tutti i locali dotati di slot machine.
Uno di questi titoli è sicuramente Fowl Play Gold, la slot con la gallina d’oro a cui abbiamo dedicato una recensione, e l’altro è l’immancabile Haunted House slot. Questi due giochi hanno molte caratteristiche in comune, come avremo modo di sottolineare nei prossimi punti di questa recensione ed è un piacere per noi andare ad analizzare un pezzo di storia come quello rappresentato da questa slot.
Cominciamo quindi con l’aspetto più immediato.

Haunted House slot machine: il comparto grafico e sonoro
Proprio come la gemella di fama di cui abbiamo parlato prima, anche Haunted House della WMG è dotata di una grafica semplice ma non banale, in grado di rimanere nell’immaginario dei giocatori che l’hanno provata per molti anni a venire.
La cornice che accompagna la griglia di gioco (non potendo essere presente il cabinato che abbiamo imparato ad amare) è il classico panorama di un film horror: sulla destra si trova un albero decrepito con i lunghi rami che ricordano delle dita scheletriche, sulla sinistra si trova invece la casa infestata che dà il nome alla slot stessa.
I colori di questo scenario non sono propriamente di atmosfera, con tonalità molto accese riprese anche all’interno dei vari simboli, ma non importa: lo scopo di questi titoli era di portare colore e divertimento nella vita dei giocatori e non di tentare invano di spaventarli.
I vari simboli che i nostalgici ancora amano si trovano al centro della schermata di gioco: si passa da elementi della casa infestata come i vampiri, il mostro di Frankenstein e la casa stessa per poi passare all’innocua frutta composta da limoni, arance, angurie e ciliegie.
Solo al momento di una vincita l’atmosfera si farà leggermente più cupa, con il cielo dello sfondo che diventa notturno e tuoni che sferzano l’aria.
Ed è un suono che vorremo sentire spesso, dato che è associato alle vincite!

Haunted House: meccaniche di gioco
Da un punto di vista prettamente tecnico, la slot Haunted House slot, trovandosi alla base di molte altre slot della WMG, ne rispecchia i canoni che le hanno rese famose. Vediamoli insieme: un RTP pari al 90%, inferiore alla media di mercato ma che comunque permette di ottenere un buon numero di vincite durante il proprio gameplay.
La griglia è suddivisa in cinque rulli e tre linee orizzontali, dalla cui intersezione nascono i quindici simboli che vengono mostrata in ogni giocata. Le linee di vincita variano in base al valore della puntata, passando da un minimo di 5 a un massimo di 10, motivo per cui molti giocatori preferiscono giocare puntando il massimo possibile.
Nel gioco si trovano due simboli speciali, il primo è il simbolo Wild che può sostituire tutti gli altri nelle combinazioni. Il secondo è un simbolo Scatter, ovvero che dà accesso alla modalità bonus in qualsiasi posizione si trovi, purché se ne trovino almeno tre in un’unica giocata.
In questa modalità, ci troveremo a dare a scalare i vari piani della stessa casa infestata. Ogni piano è dotato di cinque porte che possiamo aprire e il nostro numero di vite varierà in base a quanti simboli scatter abbiamo ottenuto, da un minimo di 3 a un massimo di 5.
Queste vite sono importanti per raggiungere il premio finale, poiché dietro ogni porta possiamo trovare diversi risultati che aiuteranno od ostacoleranno la nostra scalata. Il fantasma, ad esempio, ci priverà di una vita, mentre la mano ci spingerà verso il piano successivo (è inoltre possibile ottenere premi minori che si sommeranno in una vincita finale).
Riassumendo il tutto: ci troviamo di fronte a una slot in cui la strategia di gioco del giocatore conta molto di più rispetto a tanti titoli moderni in cui siamo costretti a premere sempre lo stesso pulsante nel tentativo di ottenere una vincita. La scelta relativa al numero delle linee di vincita e soprattutto a quella di quali rulli bloccare o meno diventa una componente essenziale per personalizzare la propria esperienza di gioco.

Slot simili a Haunted House Slot
Non è facile trovare slot machine che siano simili a questo titolo della WMG. Parlando di meccaniche di gioco, la più simile rimane ovviamente Fowl Play Gold. Se invece vogliamo esplorare il tema dell’horror in tutte le sue sfumature, possiamo suggerire diversi titoli: da Spooky Family della iSoftBet a Haunted Night della Genesis, per passare dall’omonima Haunted House della Playtech, la quale utilizza un meccanismo completamente diverso e molto simile alle slot molto vecchie da casinò.


Domande Frequenti 
Haunted House Online è una slot legale?

Sì, rispecchia tutti gli standard di sicurezza, ma per essere davvero sicuro dovrai provarla solo su casinò online con licenza.



Si può giocare alla slot Haunted House Online gratis?

Certamente, sia dal nostro sito, ma anche in versione For Fun su alcuni casinò online.



Haunted House Online ha un buon RTP?

Non proprio, visto che il suo RTP è del 90% ed è molto al di sotto della media (fissata al 96%).

raw_translation.response:
Haunted House: A Slot Game with a Spooky Twist

When it comes to popular slot games in Italy, there are two titles that immediately come to mind for most people. Both of these games are developed by WMG and owe their fame to a combination of intuitive gameplay, eye-catching graphics, and widespread distribution in all locations with slot machines.

One of these titles is definitely Fowl Play Gold, the slot game with the golden chicken that we have previously reviewed, and the other is the inevitable Haunted House slot. These two games have many features in common, as we will highlight in this review. It is a pleasure for us to analyze a piece of history represented by this slot game.

Let's start with the most immediate aspect.

Haunted House slot machine: graphics and sound

Just like its famous twin sister, Haunted House by WMG is equipped with a simple but not banal graphics, capable of remaining in the players' imagination for many years to come.

The frame that accompanies the game grid (as the slot machine cabinet that we have learned to love cannot be present) is the classic panorama of a horror movie: on the right is a decrepit tree with long branches resembling skeletal fingers, while on the left is the haunted house that gives the name to the slot itself.

The colors of this scenario are not particularly atmospheric, with very bright tones also found within the various symbols. But it doesn't matter: the purpose of these games was to bring color and fun into the players' lives, rather than trying in vain to scare them.

The various symbols that nostalgics still love are located in the center of the game screen: we go from haunted house elements such as vampires, Frankenstein's monster and the house itself, to innocent fruits made up of lemons, oranges, watermelons and cherries.

Only at the moment of a win does the atmosphere become slightly darker, with the backgroun sky turning night and thunder crackling in the air. And it's a sound we'll want to hear often, since it's associated with winning!

Haunted House: gameplay mechanics

From a purely technical point of view, the Haunted House slot game, being at the base of many other WMG slots, reflects the canons that made them famous.

Let's look at them together: an RTP of 90%, lower than the market average but still allowing for a good number of wins during your gameplay.

The grid is divided into five reels and three horizontal lines, from the intersection of which the fifteen symbols that are displayed in each game are born. The paylines vary depending on the value of the bet, ranging from a minimum of 5 to a maximum of 10, which is why many players prefer to bet the maximum amount possible.

In the game, there are two special symbols: the first is the Wild symbol, which can substitute all others in the combinations. The second is a Scatter symbol, which gives access to the bonus mode in any position, as long as at least three are found in a single game.

In this mode, we will find ourselves climbing the various floors of the haunted house. Each floor has five doors that we can open and our number of lives will vary depending on how many scatter symbols we have obtained, from a minimum of 3 to a maximum of 5.

These lives are important to reach the final prize, as behind each door we can find different results that will help or hinder our climb. The ghost, for example, will take away one life, while the hand will push us towards the next floor (it is also possible to obtain lesser prizes that will add up to a final win).

In summary, we are facing a slot game in which the player's gameplay strategy counts much more than in many modern titles where we are forced to press the same button repeatedly in an attempt to win. The choice regarding the number of paylines and above all which reels to hold or release becomes an essential component to personalize your gaming experience.

Similar Slots to Haunted House Slot

It is not easy to find slot machines that are similar to this WMG title. Speaking of gameplay mechanics, the most similar is obviously Fowl Play Gold. If instead, we want to explore the theme of horror in all its shades, we can suggest several titles: from Spooky Family by iSoftBet to Haunted Night by Genesis, to the eponymous Haunted House by Playtech, which uses a completely different mechanism similar to very old casino slots.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Haunted House Online a legal slot game?

Yes, it complies with all safety standards, but to be truly safe, you should only try it on licensed online casinos.

Can you play Haunted House Slot Online for free?

Certainly, both from our site and in the For Fun version on some online casinos.

Does Haunted House Online have a good RTP?

Not really, since its RTP is 90%, which is much below the average (set at 96%).

Review:
 
Gameplay Mechanics

Haunted House by WMG reflects the canons that made it famous. It has an RTP of 90% which is below the average, but it still allows for a good number of wins during gameplay. The grid is divided into five reels and three horizontal lines, there are 15 symbols that display in each game. The game has two special symbols: the Wild symbol, which can substitute all others in the combinations, and the Scatter symbol, which gives access to the bonus mode in any position, as long as at least three are found in a single game.

Graphics and Sound

The graphics are simple but not banal and able to remain in the players' imagination for many years to come. The RTP of Haunted House is 90%, which is much lower than average (set at 96%).

Special Symbols

In the game, there are two special symbols: the Wild symbol, which can substitute all others in the combinations, and the Scatter symbol, which gives access to the bonus mode in any position, as long as at least three are found in a single game.

Bonus Mode

In the bonus mode, players will find themselves climbing the various floors of the haunted house. Each floor has five doors which players can open. The number of lives will vary depending on how many scatter symbols are obtained, from a minimum of three to a maximum of five. These lives are important to reach the final prize, as behind each door players can find different results that will help or hinder their climb. The ghost, for example, will take away one life, while the hand will push players towards the next floor. It is also possible to obtain lesser prizes that will add up to a final win.

Theme

Haunted House is a horror-themed video slot game filled with haunting symbols like vampires, Frankenstein's monster, and the haunted house itself. It is designed to bring fun and color to players' lives rather than to scare them.

Similar Slots

Review: Haunted House: A Slot Game with a Spooky Twist

When it comes to popular slot games in Italy, there are two titles that immediately come to mind for most people. Both of these games are developed by WMG and owe their fame to a combination of intuitive gameplay, eye-catching graphics, and widespread distribution in all locations with slot machines.

One of these titles is definitely Fowl Play Gold, the slot game with the golden chicken that we have previously reviewed, and the other is the inevitable Haunted House slot. These two games have many features in common, as we will highlight in this review. It is a pleasure for us to analyze a piece of history represented by this slot game.

Let's start with the most immediate aspect.

Haunted House slot machine: graphics and sound

Just like its famous twin sister, Haunted House by WMG is equipped with a simple but not banal graphics, capable of remaining in the players' imagination for many years to come.

The frame that accompanies the game grid (as the slot machine cabinet that we have learned to love cannot be present) is the classic panorama of a horror movie: on the right is a decrepit tree with long branches resembling skeletal fingers, while on the left is the haunted house that gives the name to the slot itself.

The colors of this scenario are not particularly atmospheric, with very bright tones also found within the various symbols. But it doesn't matter: the purpose of these games was to bring color and fun into the players' lives, rather than trying in vain to scare them.

The various symbols that nostalgics still love are located in the center of the game screen: we go from haunted house elements such as vampires, Frankenstein's monster and the house itself, to innocent fruits made up of lemons, oranges, watermelons and cherries.

Only at the moment of a win does the atmosphere become slightly darker, with the backgroun sky turning night and thunder crackling in the air. And it's a sound we'll want to hear often, since it's associated with winning!

Haunted House: gameplay mechanics

From a purely technical point of view, the Haunted House slot game, being at the base of many other WMG slots, reflects the canons that made them famous.

Let's look at them together: an RTP of 90%, lower than the market average but still allowing for a good number of wins during your gameplay.

The grid is divided into five reels and three horizontal lines, from the intersection of which the fifteen symbols that are displayed in each game are born. The paylines vary depending on the value of the bet, ranging from a minimum of 5 to a maximum of 10, which is why many players prefer to bet the maximum amount possible.

In the game, there are two special symbols: the first is the Wild symbol, which can substitute all others in the combinations. The second is a Scatter symbol, which gives access to the bonus mode in any position, as long as at least three are found in a single game.

In this mode, we will find ourselves climbing the various floors of the haunted house. Each floor has five doors that we can open and our number of lives will vary depending on how many scatter symbols we have obtained, from a minimum of 3 to a maximum of 5.

These lives are important to reach the final prize, as behind each door we can find different results that will help or hinder our climb. The ghost, for example, will take away one life, while the hand will push us towards the next floor (it is also possible to obtain lesser prizes that will add up to a final win).

In summary, we are facing a slot game in which the player's gameplay strategy counts much more than in many modern titles where we are forced to press the same button repeatedly in an attempt to win. The choice regarding the number of paylines and above all which reels to hold or release becomes an essential component to personalize your gaming experience.

Similar Slots to Haunted House Slot

It is not easy to find slot machines that are similar to this WMG title. Speaking of gameplay mechanics, the most similar is obviously Fowl Play Gold. If instead, we want to explore the theme of horror in all its shades, we can suggest several titles: from Spooky Family by iSoftBet to Haunted Night by Genesis, to the eponymous Haunted House by Playtech, which uses a completely different mechanism similar to very old casino slots.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Haunted House Online a legal slot game?

Yes, it complies with all safety standards, but to be truly safe, you should only try it on licensed online casinos.

Can you play Haunted House Slot Online for free?

Certainly, both from our site and in the For Fun version on some online casinos.

Does Haunted House Online have a good RTP?

Not really, since its RTP is 90%, which is much below the average (set at 96%).
